results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology as a design research study combining prompt engineering experiments and an evaluation study with caregivers. (e.g., "The objective of the current study is to determine how to effectively generate conversational support...")

Sections 4 (Sample), 4.2 (Material and Procedure), and 4.3 (Data and Processing) provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including recruitment, data collection, and analysis.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available.

The document states that IRB approval was obtained and informed consent was taken, implying privacy concerns prevent open data sharing. (e.g., "IRB approval for this study was obtained, and informed consent was taken from human subjects.")
There is no mention of a data dictionary or codebook explaining variables, formats, or preprocessing steps, although some details are provided in section 4.1.2 and 4.3.
Data collection methods are fully described, including semi-structured interviews, prototyping sessions, and annotation of screenshots (Section 4.2).
The document does not state that the analysis code is shared in an open repository.
Since the code is not shared, there is no justification needed.
The document mentions using OpenAI Whisper for transcription but does not share the code used for data preparation or preprocessing.
The study primarily uses qualitative methods; quantitative methods are not central to the analysis.
The study primarily uses qualitative methods; quantitative methods are not central to the analysis.
The document provides subjective context and interpretation of the caregiver feedback and themes identified (e.g., Section 5, Theme 1 & 2).
The data analysis process, including thematic analysis with open coding, is clearly described (Section 4.4). The process of independent coding and consolidation is also mentioned.
The results are clearly presented in sections 5 and 6, with themes and supporting quotes from the interviews.
Section 6.4 explicitly discusses limitations and potential biases, including latency, LLM choice, and participant demographics.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on platforms like the Open Science Foundation.
